means: 发芽( sprout的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Sprouted beans only need to be cooked for 1-2 minutes.
sentence.Network_cn: 豆芽只需烹炒一到两分钟。

sentence.Network_en: We can't use these potatoes; they've all sprouted.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些土豆儿不能吃了,都出芽了.

PerfectNetExp.abs: ...sprout　① （发）芽 ② 抱子甘蓝［Rrassica germmifera］sprouted　已发芽的spruce beer　含有加拿大杉浸出液的啤酒；针枞酒；云杉酒.
n.苗芽sprouted萌芽的, 发了芽的sprouting
the tea plants sprouted new buds after the pruning ., 茶树修剪后又萌发了新枝.
The boy sprouted up a few inches during the summer ., 这个男孩在这个夏天长高了几英寸.

entry.tran: (植物、蔬菜、种子)发芽，抽芽，长芽
entry.def: When plants, vegetables, or seeds sprout, they produce new shoots or leaves.

example.ex: It only takes a few days for beans to sprout.
example.tran: 豆子只要几天就能发芽。

entry.def: When leaves, shoots, or plants sprout somewhere, they grow there.

example.ex: Leaf-shoots were beginning to sprout on the hawthorn...
example.tran: 山楂树上开始长出叶芽。

example.ex: Birch trees sprouted from the rubble and grew into a dense young wood.
example.tran: 桦树从瓦砾中长出来，形成了一片茂密的新林。

entry.def: If a garden or other area of land sprouts plants, they start to grow there.

example.ex: ...the garden, which had had time to sprout a shocking collection of weeds.
example.tran: 久而久之便野草丛生的花园

entry.tran: (出于食用目的)使(豆子、种子等)发芽
entry.def: If you sprout beans or seeds, you make them grow small shoots before eating them. You usually do this by soaking them in water.

example.ex: When you sprout seeds their nutritional content increases...
example.tran: 让种子发芽后，其营养含量会提高。

example.ex: Sprouted beans only need to be cooked for 1-2 minutes.
example.tran: 豆芽只需烹炒一到两分钟。

entry.def: If something such as hair sprouts from a person or animal, or if they sprout it, it grows on them.

example.ex: She is very old now, with little, round, wire-rimmed glasses and whiskers sprouting from her chin...
example.tran: 她现在很老了，戴着圆圆的金属架小眼镜，下巴上还长出了胡须。

example.ex: As well as sprouting a few grey hairs, Kevin seems to be suffering the occasional memory loss.
example.tran: 除长出了些许白发外，凯文似乎还患上了间歇性失忆。

entry.def: If a large number of things have appeared or developed somewhere, you can say that they have sprouted there or that the place has sprouted them.

example.ex: More than a million satellite dishes have sprouted on homes across the country...
example.tran: 100 多万个卫星接收器迅速出现在了全国各地的家庭用户中。

example.ex: Since its first shop was opened in 1976, it has sprouted outlets in 39 countries.
example.tran: 自从 1976 年开设第一家店以来，它已经在 39 个国家里开设了大量分店。

entry.def: Sprouts are vegetables that look like tiny cabbages. They are also called brussels sprouts .
Sprouts are new shoots on plants.

example.ex: After eleven days of growth the number of sprouts was counted.
example.tran: 经过11天的生长后，对新芽的数量进行了计数。

means.word_mean: 1. (of growing vegetation) having just emerged from the ground;

auth_sentence.content: Good times haven't sprouted for all farmers.
auth_sentence.res_content: Good times haven't sprouted for all farmers.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Good times haven't sprouted for all farmers.

auth_sentence.content: Enormous fungi sprouted in the thick clay of the ploughed fields.
auth_sentence.res_content: Enormous fungi sprouted in the thick clay of the ploughed fields.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Enormous fungi sprouted in the thick clay of the ploughed fields.

auth_sentence.content: Using humor and creative hairstyling, a fraternity of facial hair sprouted.
auth_sentence.res_content: Using humor and creative hairstyling, a fraternity of facial hair sprouted.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Using humor and creative hairstyling, a fraternity of facial hair sprouted.
